description: From Middle English gardener, either calqued or loaned from Anglo-Norman and Old Northern French gardinier.
See garden, and compare German Gärtner (“gardener”), which is equivalent to a derivative of the German cognate to English garden, Garten (“garden”), + -er.

entries.meaning: One who gardens; one who grows plants or cultivates a garden.
examples: "Ponder the fact that God has made you a gardener, to root out vice and to plant virtue." — St. Catherine of Siena
